titleStmt.title: Variants of the bound pronoun 2nd person plural feminine
titleStmt.author: Veronika Engler

sourceDesc.p: This is the feature-file for the 2nd person plural feminine bound pronoun.

revisionDesc.change: For EGY-___ there are no values found
updating references to Zotero IDs via update-bibl-refs.xsl

wib:featureValueObservation.note: -ku is used both for 2.pl.masc and 2.pl.fem. but when a negation is attached, the forms -kūš (masc.) - kinniš (fem.) are attested.
Contrasting with Behnstedt's (2019) findings in Jurdeih, where -čan is attested
mostly found in the villages of Transjordan
Many speakers do not use the f. form, only the m. one, which makes it a communis.

cit.quote: -kin according to De Jong, -ken according to Nishio 1992 (mentioned by De Jong).
